root.title: Procedure for Cleaning and Maintaining a Bicycle

section.p: The following procedure outlines the steps necessary to properly clean and maintain a bicycle.

itemizedlist.listitem: Detergent (sup-0002) for washing the bike (applicable only to app-0002 bikes)
Alternative detergent (sup-0003) for washing the bike (applicable only to app-0001 bikes)

section.title: Safety Precautions
section.warning: Do not get degreaser or detergents into your eyes. If it gets into your eyes, wash them immediately with clean warm water.
section.caution: Avoid using high-pressure water hoses, as they can cause damage to the bike's components.
When applying alternative detergent (sup-0003), follow the instructions on the container to avoid damaging the bike's paint.

section.title: Step 1: Clean the Bicycle with Water
section.p: Clean the bicycle with water to remove all dirt. Refer to figure 1 for more information.

section.title: Step 2: Use a Brush to Clean Hard-to-Reach Areas
section.p: Use a stiff-bristled brush or scrubber (seq-0002) to clean areas that are difficult to reach, such as the shift levers, knobbly tires, and brakes.

section.title: Step 3: Remove Caked Grime from Chain and Sprockets
section.p: Clean the caked grime from the chain and sprockets using a screwdriver with a small blade.

section.title: Step 4: Degrease Freewheel Assembly
section.p: Remove grease from the freewheel assembly using degreaser (sup-0001). Refer to figure 2 for more information.

section.title: Step 5: Flush Sprockets, Derailleurs, Chain Rings, and Chain with Water
section.p: Flush the sprockets, derailleurs, chain rings, and chain with water. Repeat if necessary.

section.title: Alternative Procedures for Specific Bike Models

orderedlist.listitem: Soak a sponge (seq-0003) in detergent (sup-0002) and water.
Clean the bicycle with the soaked sponge.
Flush the bicycle to remove all detergent residue.
Move the bicycle up and down on its tires to remove excess water.
Soak a sponge (seq-0003) in alternative detergent (sup-0003) and water.
Clean the bicycle with the soaked sponge.
Soak the sponge again in detergent (sup-0002) and water.
Fully clean the bicycle with the soaked sponge.
Flush the bicycle to remove all detergent residue.
Move the bicycle up and down on its tires to remove excess water.

section.title: Step 6: Lubricate the Bicycle
section.p: Lubricate the bicycle according to the instructions in dmRef.

section.title: Closing Requirements
section.p: Ensure that the bicycle is dry before storing or using it again.
